locutie.beschrijving: The sermon addresses the reality of human depravity and the fall of the world (Megan Kanka, Pol Pot, environmental decay) and contrasts it with the biblical claim of salvation by grace alone.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: Strong focus on the 'total depravity' aspect of Ephesians 2. The exegesis is more thematic/theological than verse-by-verse, focusing on the 'children of wrath' concept.

illocutie.beschrijving: The preacher primarily asserts the state of the world (Assertive) to create a 'need' for the promise, then shifts to proclaiming the finished work of Christ (Commissive/Declarative).
voorbeelden: The world in and of itself is not a good place.
We have been saved.
I am hitting you in the face with all this.

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: To move the hearer from despair/denial about the world to a state of relief and gratitude through the 'thrilling news' of grace.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Explicitly mentioned: 'We, the people called into being by the Holy Spirit'.

voorbeelden: The Bible teaches us that the world is full of evil.
Nature is red in tooth and claw.
Goya had a deeply Catholic sense that man was a fallen and sinful creature.
Do not think that this is true only in cities.
Please notice two things.
Walk in this light (implied).
I feel deeply depressed and angry.
I force myself to read and pray.
I like to escape just as much as the next person.
God... made us alive together with Christ.
By grace you have been saved.
He pardons our offenses.
commissieven.kwaliteit: High. The preacher uses the 'Toezegging' (Promise) as a definitive, unconditioned fact.

voorbeelden: We have been saved (as a present reality change).
Amen.
declaratieven.autoriteit: Moderate. The preacher relies on the authority of the Text/Paul more than a direct 'I forgive you' persona.

indicatoren: Extensive anecdotes about news reports (Megan Kanka, Pol Pot, CIA).
Lengthy descriptions of the 'human condition' and 'nature red in tooth and claw'.
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer receives a lot of information about sin and the world, potentially leading to intellectual agreement or emotional exhaustion before the 'event' occurs.

missende_elementen: Direct address of the promise to the specific congregation's current pain
performatief_deficit_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer hears that 'we' are saved, but might miss the 'I am being saved now' moment.

toezegging_check.kwaliteit_toezeggen: Very strong and unconditional. It rejects all 'ifs'.
voorbeelden: Not 'maybe you will be saved'... Just saved.
By grace you have been saved.

eerste_persoon.gebruik: Personal anecdotes and 'we' as a collective human race.

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Direct address: 'You may well ask', 'You and I naturally congratulate ourselves'.
tweede_persoon.performatieve_context: Used to implicate the hearer in sin and then in the promise.

derde_persoon.gebruik: Describing the world, the news, Goya, Paul, and the mother/daughter story.
derde_persoon.distantie_effect: Creates a 'lecture' feel in the first half.

tijdloos_present.gebruik: General truths about the world and theology.

actueel_present.gebruik: The 'now' of salvation and the church's current calling.

sacramenteel_patroon.beschrijving: Assertive (The world is fallen) -> Commissive (God has saved you) -> Directive (Hold the ground).
voorbeelden: The world needs to be saved... But God made us alive... What we are called to do is stand our ground.
sacramenteel_patroon.kwaliteit: The transition from the 'indicative' of grace to the 'imperative' of the church as 'advance troops' is homiletically sound.

voorbeelden_goede_verhouding: Because we are saved, we are called to be advance troops.

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: The sermon is a classic 'Law and Gospel' structure. It spends a surplus of time on the 'Law' (constative description of a fallen world) to make the 'Gospel' (commissive promise of grace) performatively effective.

sterke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: Not 'saved if you are good'... Just saved.
sterke_punten.effect: Removes the 'if' and grounds faith in God's action.

zwakke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: Lengthy descriptions of Megan Kanka and Pol Pot.
zwakke_punten.probleem: The 'event' is delayed by a long 'talking about' the world's problems.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: The sermon becomes an event when it breaks the 'if' of salvation, but it takes a long time to get there.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: The 'Toezegging' (Promise) is handled with high theological purity.

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: Implicit. The preacher speaks for the 'Biblical frame of mind'.
openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: Yes, especially in the section on 'thrilling news'.
tekstueel_bewijs: The letter to the Ephesians brings us this truly thrilling news.

pneumatologie.perlocutie_theologie: Implicitly left to the 'transformation' of the hearer.
tekstueel_bewijs: We, the people called into being by the Holy Spirit.

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: Yes, the sermon treats the word 'Saved!' as a reality-changing declaration.
sacramentstheologie.epifanisch_taalgebruik: Yes, in the description of the mother's face softening.
tekstueel_bewijs: A new situation is created where judgment is not destructive.

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is heavy on 'is' and 'was' (Assertives). It needs more 'I promise' or 'God declares' (Commissives/Declaratives).

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: The Bible teaches us that the world is full of evil.
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: Look at the darkness in your own heart and hear God's word: you are not left to your sweating self.
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Shifts from a lecture about the Bible to a direct address of the hearer.

voorbeeldzinnen: I announce to you today: you are saved.

adressering_verbetering.probleem: Too much 'we' and 'they' in the first half.
adressering_verbetering.suggestie: Use more 'you' (singular/plural) to bring the fallenness home before the grace.

indicatief_imperatief_herstel.suggestie: Keep the imperative (standing ground) as a response to the indicative (saved).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A powerful example of the 'Toezegging'. While the intro is long, the performative core of 'Just saved' is homiletically brilliant.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: SvT would focus on the preacher's 'self-revelation' about his walk; SAT focuses on the 'Declarative' power of the word 'Saved' to change the hearer's status before God.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: Rhetoric would praise the 'vivid imagery' of the water-bug; SAT asks if that imagery serves the illocutionary force of the promise.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT reveals that the sermon's power isn't in the 'ghastly circumstances' described, but in the 'Commissive' act where God binds Himself to the hearer.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: By grace you have been saved through faith.
kernzinnen_analyse.effectiviteit: The theological anchor of the sermon.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: The world in and of itself is not a good place.
kernzinnen_analyse.effectiviteit: Sets the stage but risks constative surplus.

appendices.notities: The sermon successfully avoids moralism (Directives) by grounding everything in the 'event' of being saved.
